title: Rivière des Pins (Nicolet River tributary)
text:
The Rivière des Pins ("English: River of the Pines") is a tributary of the <a href="Nicolet%20River">Nicolet River</a> which flows on the south bank of the <a href="Saint%20Lawrence%20River">Saint Lawrence River</a>. The Pins River flows through the municipalities of <a href="Saint-R%C3%A9mi-de-Tingwick%2C%20Quebec">Saint-Rémi-de-Tingwick</a>, <a href="Tingwick%2C%20Quebec">Tingwick</a>, <a href="Warwick%2C%20Quebec">Warwick</a> and <a href="Saint-Albert-de-Warwick">Saint-Albert-de-Warwick</a>, in the <a href="regional%20county%20municipality">regional county municipality</a> (MRC) of <a href="Arthabaska%20County%2C%20Quebec">Arthabaska</a>, in the region of <a href="Centre-du-Qu%C3%A9bec">Centre-du-Québec</a>, in <a href="Quebec">Quebec</a>, in <a href="Canada">Canada</a>.
Geography.
The main hydrographic slopes neighboring the "Rivière des Pins" areː
The "Rivière des Pins" originates from several agricultural and forestry streams in the municipality of <a href="Saint-R%C3%A9mi-de-Tingwick%2C%20Quebec">Saint-Rémi-de-Tingwick</a>. This area is located to the northwest of the route from range 8th and 9th.
From its head zone, the Rivière des Pins flows over according to the following segmentsː
The "Rivière des Pins" flows into a bend on the south bank of the <a href="Nicolet%20River">Nicolet River</a> at upstream from the bridge of the village of <a href="Saint-Albert-de-Warwick">Saint-Albert-de-Warwick</a> and downstream from the 10e rang West bridge, in the heart of the city of <a href="Victoriaville">Victoriaville</a>.
Toponymy.
The toponym "Rivière des Pins" was formalized on December 5, 1968 at the <a href="Commission%20de%20toponymie%20du%20Qu%C3%A9bec">Commission de toponymie du Québec</a>.
